answerText: "The Horla" [or "Le Horla"][10] Guy de Maupassant, the author of "The Horla" also wrote this story in which Wilhelm von Eyrick, the title character, is stabbed and killed by the prostitute Rachel who jumps out a window.
heading: Penn-ance |2012 | 4 | 13 | Literature | European | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The narrator of this story salutes a Brazilian three-master which appears to be the cause of his demise. For 10 points each: [10] Name this short story in which the title entity seems to be haunting the narrator until his house catches fire and burns down. However, the narrator cannot accept the death of the title spirit and kills himself.
